column4: just use an installation disk for breezy or debian to partition and then restart the machine with your dapper disc
the debian testing cd is like a 150mb download so it would be quick

actually I already have partitioned correctly, the problem is that the drive in question (hdb) has an ext3 partion, a swap one and a vfat partition - If I choose automatic partition the installer wants to erase the vfat partition :/
